meanings.definition: Extremely thin or bony in appearance
meanings.sent1: The scraggiest cat in the neighborhood looked like it hadn't eaten in days.
meanings.sent2: She found the scraggiest tree in the forest, its branches barely holding any leaves.
meanings.sent3: The scraggiest scarecrow in the field was so skinny, it made the birds laugh.
meanings.sent4: His scraggiest fingers reached out, resembling twigs in the winter.
meanings.sent5: The scraggiest old man she had ever seen shuffled slowly down the street, his bones visible through his skin.

meanings.definition: Having a rough or unkempt appearance
meanings.sent1: The scraggiest rug in the room was full of holes and loose threads.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the children returned home with the scraggiest hair, full of twigs and leaves.
meanings.sent3: The scraggiest dog in the shelter had a tangled mess of fur that made it look like a walking mop.
meanings.sent4: Her scraggiest painting was a chaotic mix of colors and shapes, reflecting her emotions at the time.
meanings.sent5: The scraggiest garden in the neighborhood was overgrown with weeds and wildflowers, giving it a wild charm.

meanings.sent1: Among the group of friends, she was known as the scraggiest, always getting into messy situations.
meanings.sent2: The scraggiest of the siblings was often teased for being the clumsiest one in the family.
meanings.sent3: In the competition, he was determined to prove that being the scraggiest didn't mean he couldn't win.
meanings.sent4: The scraggiest of the team members surprised everyone with their hidden talent during the performance.
meanings.sent5: Despite being the scraggiest in the class, she had the biggest heart and always helped others in need.
